metadata.Title: CVE-2022-44034 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - negligible.
metadata.Description: An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel through 6.0.6. drivers/char/pcmcia/scr24x_cs.c has a race condition and resultant use-after-free if a physically proximate attacker removes a PCMCIA device while calling open(), aka a race condition between scr24x_open() and scr24x_remove().

notes.Note: sbeattie> unfixed upstream as of 2023.01.10 cascardo> requires physically proximate access to systems with PCMCIA

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
